history.content: I'm not certain but I'm pretty sure 106 labs allow you to swap between lab sections at the start of the semester by having you indicate your preferences and then reassigning you to a lab based on your preferences. Getting in is the hardest so don't try to swap and risk losing your spot.

I am Joyee Chen, a sophomore EECS major at UC Berkeley who has as of right now been successfully enrolled (not waitlisted) for lecture, lab, and discussion sections of EECS 106A fall 2022. Following the discovery of an interesting new class which does not allow time conflict enrollment, and whose lecture conflicts with my 106A lab section time, I wish to change my lab section to another open one, but keep the discussion and lecture sections I am currently enrolled in the same.

The problem is, when I go the obvious route of trying to switch lab sections only, I cannot do that without dragging down my other sections.
Going to this site:

and clicking on "Preferences / Switch Sections", I see 

and I click on EECS C106A. This long page is what I see:

Scrolling down, and noting that Lecture 001 and Discussion 204 are the sections I am already successfully enrolled in, I see what I want: 

But when I try to click on Select, and confirm my class preferences, I get this strange page: 

What to do?
In addition, I tried following the instructions on https://sis.berkeley.edu/help/enrollment-faq/switching-related-sections. The problem is that I do not know where the "Class Adjustment" button is in the "Class Enrollment" section. Here is a screenshot of my "Class Enrollment" for reference:
What to do?

I really don't want to have to drop/waitlist all my sections needlessly when the system should allow me to only switch one lab for another if I'm rightfully enrolled.

What to do?
history.subject: EECS major cannot switch EECS 106A lab section without waitlisting himself for everything else
